channel.title: Open Source - Developer participation
channel.description: A little OT - but is there a roadmap? And if I want to participate in development is the github issue tracker a good start?

item.title: Open Source - Developer participation
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

@alex doc/roadmap.md is more long-term while github issues are more short term.

thetechnobear:

@johannes what thought have you on 'managing' this?

I don't think the number of active developers will soon create difficulties.

Read full topic

item.title: Open Source - Developer participation
item.dc:creator: @alex alex
item.description:
@alex wrote:

There is a roadmap.

look in the doc folder , you'll find a roadmap document there.
there are some good points in there. not sure if it has been updated recently,

Read full topic

item.title: Open Source - Developer participation
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

I guess what people can participate in, will vary according to skill set/interests etc, such is the nature of open source development... you can't say do X, only suggest A/B/C are important.
I guess issue tracker is best place, but its got some serious limitations (e.g. no priorities, and only @johannes can tag etc)

if we have a few developers then perhaps a 'development' category here, to discuss such things. its pretty important, we all head in the same direction, and also don't tread on each others toes... and that is easier said than done, and gets more difficult once you have more people involved.

@johannes what thought have you on 'managing' this?

EDIT: ok, created as a new topic, as perhaps we need to discuss the 'how' to do this a bit.

Read full topic
